articles.title: Saudi air defences intercept and destroy drone launched toward Abha airport -SPA - Reuters
articles.description: Saudi air defences intercepted and destroyed an explosives-laden drone targeting Abha International Airport in the southwestern part of the kingdom, the state news agency said on Saturday, citing the Saudi-led coalition fighting Iran-aligned Houthis in Yemen.
articles.content: A Saudi security officer walks past the Saudi Arabia's Abha airport, after it was attacked by Yemen's Houthi group in Abha, Saudi Arabia June 13, 2019. REUTERS/Faisal al NasserCAIRO, Nov 6 (Reuters) … [+545 chars]

articles.title: Iraq's PM escapes 'assassination attempt': military - Reuters
articles.description: A drone laden with explosives targeted the residence of Iraq's Prime Minister Mustafa al-Kadhimi in Baghdad early on Sunday in what the Iraqi military called an attempted assassination, but said Kadhimi escaped unhurt. Jayson Albano reports.

articles.title: Iran-backed militia behind attack on Iraqi PM - sources - Reuters
articles.description: A drone attack that targeted the Iraqi prime minister on Sunday was carried out by at least one Iran-backed militia group, Iraqi security officials and sources close to the militias said.

articles.title: Uganda says seven suspects killed, 100 others held during Kampala blasts investigation - Reuters
articles.description: Uganda said on Monday that seven suspects had been killed and 106 people detained during operations by the security services linked to three suicide bombings in the capital Kampala last week.

articles.title: Blast reported in mosque in Afghanistan, at least 12 wounded - local residents - Reuters
articles.description: An explosion hit a mosque in the Spin Ghar area of Nangarhar province in eastern Afghanistan during Friday prayers, wounding at least 12 people including the local mullah, a residents of the area said.

articles.title: Baths, garlands for man's best friend at Nepal's canine festival - Reuters
articles.description: Hindus across Nepal honoured their dogs with baths, garlands and special treats on Wednesday, the second day of the five-day Tihar festival, during which even crows and cows get respect.

articles.title: Pope condemns attack on Iraqi PM as vile act of terrorism - Reuters
articles.description: Pope Francis on Tuesday condemned the drone attack on Iraqi Prime Minister Mustafa al-Kadhimi's residence as a "vile act of terrorism".
articles.content:
VATICAN CITY, Nov 9 (Reuters) - Pope Francis on Tuesday condemned the drone attack on Iraqi Prime Minister Mustafa al-Kadhimi's residence as a "vile act of terrorism".

articles.title: Russian satirist faces up to 8 years jail for sketch that mocks officials - Reuters India
articles.description: A Russian satirical filmmaker was charged with hooliganism on Wednesday and could be jailed for up to eight years over a YouTube sketch in which a fictional local official accidentally blows up a bus stop, his lawyer told Reuters.

articles.title: Two policemen killed, six injured in Pakistan attacks near Afghanistan - Reuters
articles.description: Two policemen were killed and six injured, including a young girl, in attacks in northern Pakistan near Afghanistan on Saturday as local Taliban militants agreed a month's ceasefire after talks with the government, police said.

articles.description: Australia shares climbed on Monday, supported by gold and healthcare stocks, though gains were capped by a laggard performance in the financials sub-index as investors latched on to concerns over broadening inflationary risks.

articles.title: Coalition warplanes force Yemen's fishermen into the shallows
articles.description: Yemeni fisherman Yaser Rutain came back to port with a guitar shark and some sea catfish, a decent catch considering he had to keep close to shore to avoid fighter jets and helicopters of the Saudi-led coalition patrolling the Red Sea coast.
